titles.title: Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles" / Pauline Epistles

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles" [Acts] (incipit: fol. 7ra; explicit: fol. 181vb) - Introduction (ለዝንቱ፡ ቃሉ፡ ኮነ፡ ሀገሩ፡ አንጾኪያ፡ ወይእቲ፡ እምድረ፡ ሶርያ፡ ...) (incipit: fol. 181vb; explicit: fol. 68vb) - List of the "tituli" for the Acts of the Apostles: 67 titles (fols. 68vb-69rb) II) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa Rome "Epistle of Paul to the Romans" [Rom.] (fols. 70ra-94ra) III) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos qädamawi ḫabä säbʾa Qorontos "First Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians" [1 Cor.] (incipit: fol. 94ra; explicit: fol. 174rb) IV) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos dagǝmawi ḫabä säbʾa Qorontos "Second Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians" [2 Cor.] (incipit: fol. 174rb; explicit: fol. 124ra) V) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa Gälatya "Epistle of Paul to the Galatians" [Gal.] (fols. 124ra-131rb) VI) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa ʾEfeson "Epistle of Paul to the Ephesians" [Eph.] (fols. 131va-138rb) VII) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa Filṗǝsyos "Epistle of Paul to the Philippians" [Phil.] (incipit: fol. 138rb; explicit: fol. 187vb) VIII) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa Qwälasyǝs "Epistle of Paul to the Colossians" [Col.] (incipit: fol. 187vb; explicit: fol. 191va) IX) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos qädamawi ḫabä säbʾa Täsälonqe "First Epistle of Paul to the Thessalonians" [1 Thes.] (incipit: fol. 191va; explicit: fol. 143va) X) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos dagǝmawi ḫabä säbʾa Täsälonqe "Second Epistle of Paul to the Thessalonians" [2 Thes.] (fols. 143va-146ra) XI) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos qädamawi ḫabä Ṭimotewos "First Epistle of Paul to Timothy" [1 Tim.] (incipit: fol. 146ra; explicit: fol. 160vb) XII) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos dagǝmawi ḫabä Ṭimotewos "Second Epistle of Paul to Timothy" [2 Tim.] (fols. 160vb-164va) XIII) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä Tito "Epistle of Paul to Titus" [Tit.] (fols. 164vb-167ra) XIV) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä Filmona "Epistle of Paul to Philemon" [Phlm.] (incipit: fol. 167ra; explicit: fol. 177vb) XV) Mälʾǝktä Ṗawlos ḫabä säbʾa ʿǝbrawǝyan "Epistle of Paul to the Hebrews" [Heb.] (incipit: fol. 177vb; explicit: fol. 197rb)
Additiones 1-7.

copyists.copyist: The hand is very similar to that attested in Ms. Manchester, John Rylands University Library, no. 16 (StrJRyM 43-45 and pl. 3, Śǝrʿatä mǝnkwǝsǝnna, dated to ca. 1650)

owners.owner: According to Additio 4, the Ms. was purchased by Wäldä Giyorgis. Another person, Qäsäla Giyorgis, is mentionend in Additio 5.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is very worn. Both boards are cracked and repaired. The leather cover is missing (traces of leather are preserved on the inner side of both boards). The Ms. has been resewn. Quires I-VI are reinforced with parchment guards. Local parchment repair with vegetal threads on fols. 9, 19-22, 25, 37, 41-42, 44, 50, 52, 54-61, 67, 78-80; with strips of parchment on fols. 18, (45). Many fols. (also whole quires) are misplaced. Detached leaves were collected and sewn together in the rear part of the codex. Occasionally detached leaves have been inserted in reversed position (fols. 177, 178, 179, 181, 182). Some fols. are damaged: fols. 41, 44, 52, 70, 71, 115; with the loss of text: fols. 9, 14, 43, 55, 57-59, 68, 181. Larger portions of the text are difficult to read on fols. 7v, 11v-12r. Many fols. are about to fall apart along the ruled lines. Tears or holes amended on fols. 24, 105.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(6/fols. 1r-6v) – I(10/fols. 7r-16v) – II(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 17r-25v) – III(10/fols. 26r-35v) – IV(10/fols. 36r-45v) – V(8/fols. 46r-53v) – VI(8/fols. 54r-61v) – VII(8/fols. 62r-69v) – VIII(10/fols. 70r-79v) – ፪IX(10/fols. 80r-89v) – [፫]X(10/fols. 90r-99v) – [፬]XI(10/fols. 100r-109v) – ፮XII(10/fols. 110r-119v) – ፯XIII(10/fols. 120r-129v) – ፰XIV(10/fols. 130r-139v) – ፲XV(10/fols. 140r-149v) – ፱XVI(10/fols. 150r-159v) – XVII(8/fols. 160r-167v) – [፭]XVIII(7; s.l.: 7, no stub/fols. 168r-174v) – (11; s.l.: 1-11, no stubs/fols. 175r-185v) – XIX(8/fols. 186r-193v) – XX(6/fols. 194r-199v) – B(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. {200}).
The gurad of quire A is made of a single folio folded lengthwise (fols. 1, 6); it originates from a different codex. In quire II, a fol. between fols. 16 and 17. is missing (torn off from its counterpart fol. 25); this fol. has been re-inserted in a different place of the Ms. and foliated as 183. In quire VII, fol. 68 has been cut in half; the other half has been re-inserted in a different place and foliated as 181. Quires XV-XVIII have been re-inserted in a wrong order. Many fols. within the quires are misplaced. The detached fols. from different quires have been collected and sewn together (fols. 175-185). Fol. 200 serving as an protective leaf originates from a different codex.
It cannot be excluded that quires I-VII (Text I) and quires VIII-XX (Texts II-XV) previously belonged to two different codices (s. quire marks).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting remains uniform throughout the Ms. and is characterized by a fine script with broadly spaced, slightly right-sloping letters. It shows a few ancient features (e.g., form of 'six' ፮, looking like "compressed" number 'seven' ፯; number 'ten' (፲) appearing sometimes in the rare form with a ring, fol. 16ra; hook vowel marker of ጵ is attached to the left side of the stroke, fol. 187rb).

rubrications.rubrication: Groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I and II; a few lines of the incipit of all other texts; incipit of sections of Text I; the word mǝʿǝraf "chapter" and chapter numbers in Text I; the word kǝfl "section" in Texts II-VI; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I is divided into 78 chapters (mǝʿǝraf); the verse numbers (1-345) are written in the margins until chapter 68. Fol. 183 is misplaced and contains Acts 5:13-31. Text I ends on fol. 181vb (half leaf). The list of "tituli" comprises 67 titles and is written in small script.
The correct order of fols. containing Texts III, IV, VII, VIII, IX, XI, XIV-XV is as follows:
1 Cor. 1:1-12:2 (fols. 94ra-109vb); 12:2-12:24 (fol. 180ra-vb); 12:24-13:12 (fol. 185ra-vb); 13:12-16:24 (fols. 168ra-174rb)
2 Cor. 1:1-1:9 (fol. 174rb-vb); 1:9-1:16 (fol. 182va-vb); 1:16-2:2 (fol. 182ra-rb); 2:3-13:15 (fols. 110ra-124ra)
Phil. 1:1-1:29 (fols. 138rb-139vb); 1:29-2:19 (fol. 150ra-vb); 2:19-3:10 (fol. 188ra-vb); 3:10-4:23 (fols. 186ra-187vb).
Col. 1:1-1:4 (fol. 187vb); 1:4-2:13 (fols. 189ra-190vb); 2:13-4:9 (fols. 192ra-193vb); 4:10-4:18 (fol. 191ra-va)
1 Thes. 1:1-1:8 (fol. 191va); 1:8-2:13 (fol. 159ra-vb); 2:13-5:28 (fols. 140ra-143va)
1 Tim. 1:1-5:16 (fols. 146ra-149vb); 5:16-6:9 (fol. 175ra-vb); 6:9-6:21 (fol. 160ra-vb)
Phlm. 1-18 (fol. 167ra-vb); 18-25 (fol. 177va-vb)
Heb. 1:1-1:3 (fol. 177vb); 1:3-1:13 (fol. 177ra-rb); 1:13-2:8 (fol. 179va-vb); 2:8-2:16 (fol. 179ra-rb); 2:16- 10:12 (fols. 151ra-158vb); 10:12-10:26 (fol. 178va-vb); 10:26-10:35 (fol. 178ra-rb); 10:35-11:13 (fol. 176ra-vb); 11:13-11:33 (fol. 184ra-vb); 11:33-13:25 (fols. 194ra-197rb).
Most of the texts are followed by the note on stichometry (Text III in a secondary hand).

additional.cont: Fol. 2ra-rb: Excerpt from Missal.
additional.det: Alexandrian Patriarch ʾabba Marqos and Metropolitan Krǝstodolu are mentioned. Since none of the Alexandrian Patriarchs named Mark was in office during the tenure of one of the three Metropolitan called Krǝstodolu it is difficult to identify the persons mentioned here (but cp. Additio 2).

additional.cont: Fols. 2va-5vb: Excerpt from Missal.
additional.det: The Alexandrian Patriarch Matthew IV (in tenure 1660-75) and Metropolitan Krǝstodolu II (in tenure 1664-71) are mentioned on fol. 3ra.

additional.cont: Fols. 14ra-18vb, 183r-v: Excerpt from a grammar of Gəˁəz (säwasəw).
additional.det: The excerpt is written in the bottom margin in Amharic and Gǝʿǝz; it is poorly legible.
The note states Wäldä Giyorgis as the owner of this book who purchased it with his money. His name is also written on fol. 197rb.
The note, barely legible, is crudely written in the upper margin in a different hand than Additio 4 and mentions Qäsäla Giyorgis as buyer.

additional.cont: Fol. 69va: Excommunication against those who stole the book or erased its text.
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand, in red ink.

additional.cont: Fol. 69va-vb: ˀAsmat-prayer for fertility (fǝtaḥ maḥḍäna lä-ˀamätǝkä...).
Fols. 197va-199vb: Excerpt from Dǝggwa.
additional.det: The excerpt is for the most part written in a small script; the first word of each strophe is rubricated. The musical notation seems to be done in a secondary hand.

extras.extra: - The guard of quire A leaf (folded lengthwise) contains an excerpt from Dǝggwa. - Fol. 200 contains an excerpt from an unidentified text (Wǝddase ʾamlak, Missal?). - Spaces for rubricated passages (three lines on the incipit page of Text II) are left unfilled: fol. 70r - References to biblical books are written in small script between two thin lines in the margins throughout Texts II, III and IV. - Excerpts from hymns (?) are crudely written in brown ink (partly faded): fols. 3v, 49v-50v, 51v-54v, 70v-84r, 87v, 114v, 137r, 140r, 160r, 175v, 178r. - Crude notes (commentaries?) are written in the margins of fols. 95r-106r (Text III) in a secondary hand. - Scribal corrections are written interlineally indicated by a thin red line: fols. 28rb, 29rb, 35ra, 37ra, 41va, 46vb, 66rab. -Tämälläs-signs (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols. 72vb, 78va, 79rb, 95ra, 96rb, 128va, 130vb, 132rb, 168vb. - Corrections in a secondary hand are written interlineally: e.g., fols. 16va, 19rb, 20va, 24vb, 37ra, 52rb, 71va, 76ra, 80ra, 83ra, 89ra, 96ra, 96vb, 113vb, 127rb, 127vab, 130ra, 135vab, 163va, 185ra, 193ra or written over erasures: e.g., fols. 99rab, 103rb, 116vb, 159rb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 17vb, 22vb, 23vb, 26ra, 143vb. - Erasures without marking: e.g., fols. 27va, 29vb, 34ra, 56rb, 64rb, 67rb, 88rb, 101ra. - Erased note: fol. 63v. - Crude minor notes: fols. 2r, 3v, 4v, 5r, 10r, 56r, 94v, 96v, 103r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper left corner of fols. 80r: ፪, 110:፮, 120r: ፯, 130r: ፰, 150r: ፱, 140r: ፲, 176r: ፲፫(?).
